title: The Democratic Crackup
summary: Pelosi and her chaotic caucus manage to overshadow Trump-a dubious achievement.. Americans love a good political brawl, and that's terrible news for Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Her Democratic Party has commenced a full throw-down-with itself.

title: The African Future of 'America's Church'
summary: United Methodism stands alone among mainline Protestants in defense of tradition.. The United Methodist Church voted last week to uphold its rule that clergy remain celibate if single or monogamous if married. It also reaffirmed its ban on same-sex marriage. United Methodism is nearly the only major historically liberal mainline Protestant denomination to retain such stances on sex.

title: Ohio Democratic Sen. Sherrod Brown Won't Run for President
summary: Brown, re-elected to Senate in 2018, will 'do everything I can' to elect a Democrat to White House. WASHINGTON-Ohio Sen. Sherrod Brown said Thursday that he will not seek the 2020 Democratic nomination for president.

title: U.S. Seeks Access to North Korean Missile Base
summary: Satellite images show work moving toward an operational state. WASHINGTON-The U.S. will ask North Korea to admit American inspectors to a missile-launch site that Pyongyang has begun to restore, but the Trump administration hasn't concluded the facility is currently operational, a senior State Department official said.

title: The Unforced Error of Medicare for All
summary: Democrats would be wise to seek reform, not revolution.. Prominent Democrats falling over themselves to support Medicare for All are making a big mistake. For a party seeking to rebrand itself-especially in places like my native Ohio, where health crises abound-this scenario is a GOP dream. It's easy to demand universal health care, but as efforts dating back to FDR have shown, legislative victories are a slow burn. Megaphones on social media won't change that.

title: 'Liquid Rules' Review: Going With the Flow
summary: On a trans-Atlantic flight, a professor holds forth on the many liquids in the plane-from jet fuel to the glues holding the aircraft together.. Of the three phases of matter-gas, liquid and solid-scientists pay the least amount of attention to liquids. This is not because they are unimportant but because they are the hardest to understand. Gases are in a state of near constant motion, which enables one to determine their average properties, such as temperature or pressure. The atoms in solids, such as silicon or diamond, are relatively stationary, but their crystalline order dramatically simplifies the equations necessary to understand their properties. Liquids, however, are the worst of both worlds-they lack the order of crystals, while the methods that reveal the properties of gases become hard to apply when the atoms condense into a liquid.

title: Why the Bull Has Room to Run
summary: Euphoria kills economic expansions. The mood on the street now is best described as skepticism.. The bull market started March 9, 2009, 10 years ago Saturday. The S&P 500 had dropped to a close of 676 in the midst of the financial crisis, 2,072 points or 75% lower than its current 2,748 level. Given that the Federal Reserve has quintupled the size of its balance sheet in the intervening years, and that the heavy regulatory hand of the Obama administration gave way to a more salubrious attitude toward commerce under President Trump, perhaps the duration and the magnitude of the current bull market shouldn't surprise us.

title: Federal Judge Rules to Enforce Special-Education Policy
summary: Obama administration rule focused on proportions of minority students identified for special-education programs. WASHINGTON-A federal court in Washington ruled Thursday that an Obama administration policy seeking to address the high proportion of black and Hispanic children in special-education classes must go into effect.

title: India and Pakistan Are Flirting With Nuclear Disaster
summary: 'Neither side wants to escalate. But both . . . have become prisoners of their own propaganda.'. If you had to name the man most likely to spark a nuclear war, who would you pick? title: Democrats Have Taken Over Education Reform
summary: A once-heterodox movement is now monochromatically blue. That's bad for the cause.. The K-12 education-reform movement was once led primarily by conservatives and libertarians with centrist Democrats as junior partners. But over the past decade, education reform has taken a hard left turn. Republicans are now almost entirely invisible within the ranks of its activists. This progressive capture of education reform-like the capture of much of the media and academia-will undermine the quality and effectiveness of the movement's work.

title: Supreme Court Considers Implementing Code of Conduct
summary: Chief Justice John Roberts is exploring whether to come up with workplace code, Justice Elena Kagan tells Congress. WASHINGTON-Chief Justice John Roberts is weighing whether to create a code of conduct for members of the Supreme Court, Justice Elena Kagan told lawmakers Thursday, a sign that the #MeToo movement's challenge to workplace sexual harassment has reached the most powerful level of the legal profession.

title: U.S. Gives European Allies Friday Target to Sign on to Syria Proposal
summary: Washington needs to know their intentions in order to complete plans to ensure Islamic State doesn't re-establish a foothold in northeast, officials say. The Trump administration is pressing eight European allies to commit by Friday to a U.S. proposal to stabilize northeastern Syria, U.S. officials said, setting a target meant to persuade reluctant partners to join Washington in the still-developing plan.

title: Slow Growth Prods Central Banks
summary: The European Central Bank announced new stimulus plans and the Federal Reserve signaled more reluctance to raise U.S. interest rates this year. Concern over sluggish global growth is causing central bankers to shift tacks, as the European Central Bank unveiled surprise plans Thursday to stimulate the Continent's flagging economy and Federal Reserve officials signaled their growing reluctance to raise U.S. interest rates at all.

title: Wall Street Votes to Support Single Bond for Fannie, Freddie
summary: Obama, Trump administrations pushed for overhaul of market for Fannie, Freddie bonds. The world's second-largest bond market moved a step closer to its much-anticipated overhaul on Thursday when Wall Street firms voted to support a single mortgage-backed bond for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac .

title: ECB Stimulus Sinks Euro
summary: European currency falls to 21-month low against dollar, with further drop expected. A dovish shift from the European Central Bank stoked fears of slowing global growth, sending the euro Thursday to a nearly-two year low against the dollar and slamming emerging-market currencies.

title: Former Uzbek Official, Telecom Executive Charged in Bribery Scheme
summary: Daughter of late Uzbekistan President Karimov and the head of MTS's Uzbekistan subsidiary charged for alleged roles in $1 billion scheme. title: Brazil Foreign Minister Calls on Russia, China to Oppose Maduro
summary: Official says nation will appeal on behalf of opposition leader Guaidó at Brics summit. summary: Industry representatives fear legislation would destabilize the marketplace. Democratic lawmakers in Connecticut introduced legislation Thursday that would create a public option for health-care coverage, allowing individuals and small businesses to buy insurance through the state.

title: Lawmakers Propose Bill to Help Disabled Veterans Who Seek Bankruptcy
summary: Bill would protect disability payments from going to credit-card companies and other lenders. Federal lawmakers say injured veterans who file for bankruptcy shouldn't be forced to use their disability payments to pay off credit-card companies and other lenders.

title: Cream of the Crop: Why New Zealand's Stock Market Is Breaking Records
summary: Index advanced 7.1% this year, hitting several new peaks. New Zealand's stock benchmark is the first in the Asia-Pacific region to hit record highs this year. That speaks to the market's unusual makeup.

summary: A Mafia term that the book and movie popularized decades ago has tarred a number of close advisers to the president. Fifty years ago, on March 10, 1969, Mario Puzo published a novel that pulled back the curtain on the inner workings of a Mafia family. "The Godfather"-and its movie adaptation three years later by Francis Ford Coppola-would introduce the public to a raft of Italian-American mobster lingo.

title: Edward Lampert's New Sears Faces Legal Troubles
summary: New Sears sparring with the company left behind in bankruptcy and also facing a lawsuit over the use of the Craftsman name. title: Why It's So Hard to Buy the Market at the Bottom and Hang On
summary: A decade on from the stock market's financial crisis lows, investors should imagine: If they had bought at the bottom, what would they have done next?. True contrarians only buy stocks when it makes them feel physically sick. This week is exactly 10 years since the vomit-inducing moment when the S&P 500 hit an intraday low of 666 (rounding down), Citigroup became a penny stock and General Motors was considering bankruptcy.

title: 'The Case Against Adnan Syed' Review: Justice for All?
summary: A murder case gets another look in this HBO documentary miniseries.. In 1999, 18-year-old Hae Min Lee, a popular and attractive Baltimore high-school student, was found strangled in a wooded park. For which crime her former boyfriend Adnan Syed was charged and convicted. The names of the victim, the accused and a few other principals in "The Case Against Adnan Syed" (begins Sunday, 9 p.m., HBO) will be familiar to the audience that first learned of the story nearly five years ago in the popular podcast "Serial." The difference between it and this four-part series is a radical one. The HBO version's ambitious, complex and deeply detailed narrative delivers dimension to this story of doomed romance, clashing cultural values, and dubious justice as only film can.

title: ECB to Launch New Stimulus in Major Policy Reversal
summary: European Central Bank became the first rich-country central bank to take steps in response to the global slowdown.. FRANKFURT-With a major policy reversal Thursday, the ECB became the first rich-country central bank to unveil new stimulus in response to the global economic slowdown.

summary: House Energy and Commerce Committee request is latest congressional inquiry into the agency after a Wall Street Journal-Frontline investigation. title: 'Transit': Exploring the State of Being a Stateless Man
summary: The hero of Christian Petzold's film flees the forces of fascism, takes on another man's identity, then falls in love with his wife.. Instead of summoning up the haunting strangeness of Christian Petzold's "Transit" by summarizing the action, which is sporadic, or specifying the time and place, which are ambiguous, let me recount a sequence that begins with a little blob of something being heated in a teaspoon over a candle. Is it heroin? No, it's solder. The hero, Georg (Franz Rogowski), a German refugee in France, is trying to repair a loose connection on a radio while a young boy looks on, transfixed. When the radio comes to life, it plays a song that moves Georg deeply-his mother sang it to him when he was a child. As Georg sings along, the boy's mother, Melissa (Maryam Zaree), comes home from work and watches. She doesn't listen, since she's profoundly deaf, but soon, signing briskly, she tells her son to tell Georg that she'd like to watch him sing the song again. Which he does, with redoubled feeling that's reflected on her face.

title: Jerry Merryman Helped Design First Hand-held Calculator in Mid-1960s

title: Creeped Out by Facebook? Here Are the Settings to Check
summary: There's no way to turn off Facebook's tracking, but there are controls meant to limit its impact on the ads you see. Facebook still feels pretty creepy at times. You'll be talking about something, then an ad for that thing will pop up in your news feed or on Instagram. It might be all in our heads. After telling a friend how dusty my apartment was a few weeks ago, I got an ad for an air purifier. What's the most likely explanation? I noticed the ad because I was complaining about dust? Or Facebook has bugged my apartment?

As a 10-year-old, I considered it a stroke of brilliance; my cousin, whose toy I'd ruined, disagreed. title: Geneva Auto Show: How Legendary Brands Are Being Reborn as EVs
summary: Outdated auto marques like Pininfarina, Lagonda and Hispano Suiza are finding new life via electric concept cars, many of which debuted at the Geneva International Motor Show. Dan Neil reports. WALKING THE AISLES at the Geneva International Motor Show (through March 17), I was having déjà vu from before I was even born. Some of the banners hanging from the rafters of Palexpo convention center haven't been seen in decades. The winner for Most Anachronistic: Hispano Suiza, the Spanish sporting and luxury marque, summoned out of the historical ether and reimagined as a "hyper-luxe" electric sports-car atelier. At the appointed hour on Tuesday, descendants of co-founder Damián Mateu gathered for the unveiling of the "Carmen." Named after a beloved matriarch, the Carmen is a fantastical beast, a chimera, with 1,000-plus electric horsepower, gullwing doors, a hornet's tail and a face like a fruit bat. Family members weren't the only ones tearing up.

title: Teens Need the Truth About Drugs
summary: Decades of scare tactics haven't worked. What's effective is clear information about risks and alternative ways to relieve stress.. A police officer came to my school and lectured us about the evils of marijuana, heroin and LSD. My friends and I half-listened; it didn't bother us much because we were pleasantly stoned.

title: Fantasies of Alien Life
summary: Human beings have never encountered extra-terrestrials, but we've been imagining them for thousands of years. Fifty years ago this month, Kurt Vonnegut published "Slaughterhouse-Five," his classic semi-autobiographical, quasi-science fiction novel about World War II and its aftermath. The story follows the adventures of Billy Pilgrim, an American soldier who survives the bombing of Dresden in 1945, only to be abducted by aliens from the planet Tralfamadore and exhibited in their zoo. Vonnegut's absurd-looking Tralfamadorians (they resemble green toilet plungers) are essentially vehicles for his meditations on the purpose of life.

summary: Employers are amending rules and offering services to keep retiree money in company-sponsored plans. As baby boomers leave the workforce, more employers are trying to persuade them to stick with their 401(k) plans during retirement.

title: Sandra Day O'Connor's Lessons in Leadership
summary: In her 25 years on the Supreme Court, the justice demonstrated the power of civility and determination. Before voting on cases in their weekly conference, the nine justices of the Supreme Court shake hands. At her first conference, in October 1981, Sandra Day O'Connor, the first woman appointed to the Court, offered her hand to Justice Byron "Whizzer" White. The former All-Pro halfback squeezed it so hard that tears "squirted" from her eyes, she later recalled. But O'Connor was never intimidated by White. She knew that her fellow justice, easily bored and hypercompetitive, liked to putt golf balls on the rug in his chambers, so when she wanted to win his vote, she would wander down the hall to challenge him to a putting contest.

title: Huawei's Lawsuit Marks Shift to War Footing
summary: Huawei's move challenges the U.S.'s multifaceted campaign to limit its rise and cast it as a national-security threat, but it also risks further antagonizing U.S.. SHENZHEN, China-For years, Huawei Technologies Co. bided its time as the U.S. gradually escalated its campaign to rein in the Chinese telecom giant. Now, Huawei has shifted to a war footing, suing the U.S. government as the company looks to defend its global business.

title: Stocks to Watch: Amazon, Allergan, Amgen and American Eagle
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Digital-Health Startup Livongo Eyes 2019 IPO
summary: Diabetes specialist to join tech companies rushing to the public markets. Digital-health startup Livongo Health Inc. is preparing for an initial public offering as soon as the third quarter of 2019, joining a horde of technology companies racing to tap the public markets.

title: WSJ. Magazine Contributors: March 2019
summary: Photographers Jeremy Liebman, Dan Martensen, Alessandra Sanguinetti, Kyle Weeks, stylist Camille Bidault-Waddington, and writer Emily Holt contributed to this issue of the magazine. Photographer Dan Martensen travels often but rarely gets to slow down and immerse himself in a destination. A roving fashion shoot in Jamaica-"as spontaneous and magical a place as I have ever visited," he says-provided the opportunity to absorb the location and capture it on camera. "Jamaica is about the people, above all," says Martensen, who took the above snapshot of students in Black River while scouting locations. For stylist Camille Bidault-Waddington, who had never visited Jamaica before, the assignment made for an adventure-and an escape: "What better place to go in the middle of gray winter?" Pulling together looks for the shoot, she sought to reflect the Caribbean island's aesthetic, which she describes as "a bit romantic, a bit soft, a bit fluid and laid back."

title: WSJ. Magazine Editor's Letter: Culture Club
summary: Editor in Chief Kristina O'Neill introduces the March 2019 issue of WSJ. Magazine. Our March Men's Style issue features two cover stars who tap into our deepest emotions, from love to terror. Jordan Peele was best known as a comedian and co-host of the sketch show Key & Peele until his Oscar-winning debut, Get Out, transformed him into a horror auteur and social critic. Now, with the release of Us, he charts the psychic toll of privilege through a family tormented by nightmarish versions of themselves. For Peele, moving from laughs to thrills was a natural transition. "People who have done live comedy and who have written comedy develop a real sense of how an audience is going to react," he says. "It's left me obsessed with riding the audience like a wave."

title: Window for Bipartisan Compromise in Washington Narrows
summary: Disputes in Congress and expanding investigations of Trump imperil hoped-for deals on infrastructure, prescription-drug pricing. WASHINGTON-Intensifying partisan pressure in Congress is further clouding prospects for any major legislative compromises with the White House in the few months before the 2020 election cycle consumes Capitol Hill.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Declined Last Week
summary: Initial claims, an indication of layoffs across the U.S., fell by 3,000. WASHINGTON-The number of U.S. workers filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell slightly last week.

title: New Overtime Rule Expected to Boost Pay Eligibility
summary: Interest groups expect Trump administration proposal will expand overtime but to fewer workers than Obama-era plan. WASHINGTON-Business groups expect the Labor Department's forthcoming overtime proposal to be more palatable than rules sought by the prior administration, but worker advocates say it doesn't go far enough to protect Americans when they work more than 40 hours a week.

title: Tiny Stock Moves Fuel Jitters About Market Momentum
summary: After Fed comments on pausing rate increases and better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings, trading quiets down. Daily stock moves have fallen sharply following last quarter's volatility, stoking worries that the market is losing momentum after a shift by the Federal Reserve fueled the recent rally.

title: I'm an Anonymous NFL Scout, and I Think You're All Garbage
summary: As football's draft approaches, cue the petty criticism from unnamed executives. Your hands are too small. Or wait: Is it that your hands are too big? You're too slow for our offense. Or maybe...you're too fast?

title: U.S. Businesses Warn Against Hong Kong Move to Allow Extraditions to China
summary: Proposal to allow suspects wanted by Beijing to be sent across the border would undermine city's reputation, American group says. HONG KONG-A proposed law that would allow criminal suspects to be extradited from Hong Kong to mainland China is drawing opposition, including from foreign business leaders who warn Beijing could exploit the law for political purposes and shake confidence in the city.

title: American Homeowners and Their Insurers Face a Flooding Crisis From Within
summary: Data show claims for water damage from inside leaks have surged while other types of claims have fallen. More American homes are flooding from the inside.

title: Bayer's Other Big Challenge: Finding Its Next Blockbuster Drugs
summary: Litigation over Bayer's weedkillers is just one of the company's problems. Expiring patents on its top-selling drugs could pose another headache. BERLIN- Bayer AG , embroiled in a legal battle over whether its weedkillers cause cancer, faces another potentially big problem: expiring patents on its top-selling drugs, with no emerging winners in its pipeline.

title: SoftBank's Next Big Bet: Latin American Tech
summary: Japanese conglomerate launches Innovation Fund, aiming to invest at least $5 billion in region over next five years. TOKYO- SoftBank Group Corp. is launching a $5 billion fund to invest in tech startups in Latin America, dwarfing rivals in a region experiencing a surge in venture-capital inflows.

title: Biomass Mess Shows Trouble with Sustainable Investing
summary: Biofuels are increasingly seen as less green than they claim, highlighting a key challenge for environmental investment strategies. Investors focused on environmental trends may be more vulnerable to changing tastes than they think. An industry considered sustainable today can seem nefarious tomorrow-just look at biomass.

title: English Soccer's Highest-Paid Mystery
summary: Arsenal built its squad around Mesut Özil. But, despite his talent, he often doesn't play.. Arsenal has always been convinced that Mesut Özil is a soccer genius. The club was sure enough that it tripled its record transfer fee to acquire him in 2013 and remained certain enough to make him its highest paid player with a contract extension last year.

title: Is Chinese Quantitative Easing On the Way?
summary: China has a problem. Its short rates are too low and its long rates are too high.. Chinese short-term borrowing rates are too low, helping stoke a new stock bubble. Long rates are too high, thanks to surging government debt issuance. Meanwhile, private-sector borrowing is weak. What to do?

title: Oil-Price Forecasts Hold Steady for 2019
summary: OPEC-led production cuts and geopolitical risks are expected to keep crude prices rising through the first half. LONDON-Banks in February left their overall forecasts for oil prices in 2019 unchanged from January, even as they widely expected prices to rise through the first half of the year on the back of OPEC-led production curbs and geopolitical risks to global supply.

title: Fed Economists Find Tight Labor Market Can Give Boost to Marginalized Workers
summary: Benefits to certain marginalized workers increase when the unemployment rate falls below its estimated long-run level. An economy where the unemployment rate falls below estimates of its long-run level can yield outsize gains for some women and minority groups, according to new research by four veteran Federal Reserve economists.

title: February Jobs Report Expected to Show Continued Strength
summary: The U.S. notched its 100th straight month of job gains in January; that streak was likely extended in February. The U.S. government releases its broad measure of the February labor market on Friday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expect the Labor Department to report employers added 180,000 jobs while the unemployment rate ticked down to 3.9%. Here are five things to watch in the report.

title: MSCI Pulls Chinese Stock From Indexes Over Foreign Ownership Cap
summary: The weighting of a second company will be cut. Global index compiler MSCI Inc. removed a Shenzhen-listed company from its China indexes and cut the weighting of a large home-appliance maker, as international holdings of both got close to breaching national foreign-ownership limits.

title: Sour Economic Outlook Weighs on CFO Spending, Expansion Plans, Survey Finds
summary: CONTENT FROM OUR SPONSOR. Concerns about the U.S. economy are putting a chill on spending and expansion plans among U.S. executives, according to a first-quarter survey by the Association of International Certified Professionals Accountants (AICPA) released Thursday.

title: Convicted Cardinal George Pell Sued Over Alleged Child Abuse
summary: Civil action filed in Australian state court says the priest assaulted a boy in the 1970s. MELBOURNE, Australia-An Australian man is suing Cardinal George Pell alleging abuse when he was a boy four decades ago, reviving allegations against the most senior Catholic priest to be convicted of child sex offenses.

title: Aflac's Machine Learning Tools Interpret Barrage of Security Alerts
summary: Most Popular News. It's easy for companies to gather vast amounts of data about attempted cyberattacks on their systems and networks. It's harder to interpret the information and use it to formulate effective responses.

title: Policy Makers' Debt Fears Can Worsen Downturns, Say Researchers
summary: New economic study aims to explain why countries with low debt-to-GDP ratios fare better following financial crises. Academic research has shown that countries with higher levels of government debt relative to the size of their economies fare worse after financial crises than countries with lower debt levels.

title: Costco Raises Minimum Wage to $15 an Hour
summary: Wholesale retailer reported same-store sales rose sharply in the holiday quarter. Costco Wholesale Corp. said it has raised starting wages for store workers to $15 an hour, as a tight U.S. labor market continues to drive fierce competition for hourly staffers.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Cohen Told Lawyer to Seek Trump Pardon
summary: President's former lawyer testified before House committee last week, 'I have never asked for, nor would I accept, a pardon from Mr. Trump'. WASHINGTON-Michael Cohen, a former lawyer for President Trump, directed his attorney last spring to inquire about the possibility of a presidential pardon, weeks after federal agents raided his properties, Mr. Cohen's lawyer said Wednesday, apparently contradicting his testimony before a House committee last week.

title: House Democrats Split Over Measure Tied to Omar's Comments
summary: Vote on resolution condemning anti-Semitism is delayed; language condemning anti-Muslim bias is added to measure. WASHINGTON-House Democratic leaders put on hold a vote to denounce anti-Semitism as divisions grew within the party over the response to a freshman lawmaker's repeated criticism of U.S. policy toward Israel, the latest issue to roil the party since it gained a majority in November's elections.

title: Huawei Challenges U.S. Restrictions as Unconstitutional
summary: Suit challenges the constitutionality of parts of the National Defense Authorization Act. SHENZHEN, China-Huawei Technologies Co. filed a lawsuit challenging a law signed by President Trump in August that restricts federal agencies from doing business with the Chinese company, the latest in a series of countermoves by the telecommunications giant.

title: Regulators Move to Ease Crisis-Era Levers Over Financial Firms
summary: FSOC to review business sector activity rather than individual nonbank companies. Regulators dialed back a practice of publicly shaming the nation's biggest banks through "stress test" exams, taking one of the biggest steps yet to ease scrutiny put in place after the 2008 crisis.

title: Venezuela to Deport U.S. Journalist, Expels German Ambassador
summary: Moves threaten to escalate a political conflict in which President Nicolás Maduro clings to power amid increasing international opposition. Venezuela's embattled government planned to deport an American journalist who has written about dissent in the military and ordered the German ambassador to leave the country, moves that threaten to escalate a political conflict.

title: WarnerMedia Content Chief Says Competitors 'Are Eating Our Lunch'
summary: Robert Greenblatt adds division's networks need closer coordination for streaming service. Robert Greenblatt, the new chief content officer of AT&T Inc.'s recently restructured WarnerMedia entertainment division, told staffers Wednesday that creating a direct-to-consumer streaming service would require closer coordination between the company's entertainment units, saying its large competitors were "eating our lunch."

title: Russian Telecom Agrees to Pay $850 Million to Resolve Bribery Charges
summary: Mobile TeleSystems bribed an official to win business in Uzbekistan, the SEC said. A Russian telecommunications company agreed to pay $850 million to resolve federal bribery charges, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said Wednesday.

title: Democrats Won't Partner With Fox News for Primary Debates
summary: DNC Chairman Tom Perez cites media report about network's relationship with White House. WASHINGTON-The Democratic National Committee said Wednesday that Fox News won't host any 2020 Democratic primary debates because of what the committee described as the network's inappropriate relationship with President Trump.

title: Women's Clothing Retailer Charlotte Russe to Close Remaining Stores
summary: Retailer filed for chapter 11 protection last month with about 500 locations. Fast fashion retailer Charlotte Russe Holding Inc. is preparing to close its remaining stores.

title: Iranian Hackers Have Hit Hundreds of Companies in Past Two Years
summary: Cyberattack campaign has caused damages estimated at hundreds of millions of dollars, focusing on Middle East but also affecting U.S.. Cyberattacks linked to Iranian hackers have targeted thousands of people at more than 200 companies over the past two years, Microsoft Corp. said, part of a wave of computer intrusions from the country that researchers say has hit businesses and government entities around the globe.

title: Facebook Plans New Emphasis on Private Communications
summary: Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg sees Facebook's future focused more on private sharing than public content. Facebook Inc., which became the world's biggest social network by encouraging people to share photos and messages publicly, said it is now betting on the opposite: that the future of social media lies in private messaging and small-group chats.

title: NSA in 'Deliberative Process' Over Metadata Surveillance, Its Chief Says
summary: Gen. Paul Nakasone notes reports on ending controversial collection of domestic phone metadata. SAN FRANCISCO-The director of the National Security Agency said Wednesday the spy agency was "in a deliberative process" over the future of its controversial surveillance program that collects domestic phone metadata and is up for congressional renewal at the end of the year.

title: Trade Deficit Freak Out
summary: The rising gap is the result of faster growth. There's no need to panic.. Where's the Valium? Mass quantities may be needed to calm the apparent media panic over Wednesday's Commerce Department report that the U.S. trade deficit hit a record last year. Everyone can calm down, and President Trump can take a bow that his tax reform and deregulation are working as intended.

title: Speaker Ocasio-Cortez
summary: House leaders seem to be afraid of their radical backbenchers.. Don't be surprised if either Paul Ryan or John Boehner has put in an empathy call to current House Speaker Nancy Pelosi this week. The former Republican House Speakers know all about willful backbenchers, and Democratic Reps. Ilhan Omar and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez make the GOP Freedom Caucus look like powder puffs.

title: Trump Gets Exercised Over Exercises
summary: War simulations with allies are crucial to military deterrence.. New satellite photos show North Korea may be prepping for another nuclear test after the summit in Hanoi. That's all the more reason for President Trump to rethink his cancellation of large military exercises with South Korea.

title: NYPD Reaches New Milestone in Body-Camera Program
summary: All of the New York City Police Department's 20,000 uniformed officers now have body cameras. The New York City Police Department said it had equipped all of its 20,000 uniformed officers with body cameras, notching a new milestone in the rollout of the devices despite setbacks last fall when some of them malfunctioned.

title: Senator Reveals She Was Raped While in Air Force
summary: Arizona's Martha McSally, an ex-fighter pilot, makes disclosure at hearing on military sexual assault. WASHINGTON-Sen. Martha McSally (R., Ariz.) said during a Senate hearing Wednesday that she was raped by a superior officer while she was serving in the Air Force.

title: MTA Investigates Second Piece of Debris to Fall From Subway Line
summary: Piece of rusted metal follows similar incident last month; no injuries. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has launched an investigation after a piece of debris fell onto a car in Queens, apparently from an elevated subway line.

title: Trouble for Justin Trudeau
summary: A criminal-justice scandal makes Canada's prime minister vulnerable.. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will face the Canadian electorate in October-if his leadership survives that long. His political career is threatened by a member of his own Liberal Party, Jody Wilson-Raybould, who served as Canada's first Indigenous attorney general and justice minister until she was unceremoniously demoted in January to veterans-affairs minister.

title: Afghanistan's Post-9/11 Generation
summary: I was 4 when the Taliban took over my town in 1998. I think how far we have come and dread going back.. Kabul, Afghanistan

title: MTA Back in Albany Amid Congestion-Pricing Push
summary: Gov. Cuomo is pushing to authorize its inclusion in next state budget, which is due April 1. New York state lawmakers on Wednesday asked the Metropolitan Transportation Authority for new bus lines in Queens, more money for the Long Island Rail Road and greater representation for suburban commuters, as the authority pushes for a system of congestion pricing.

title: California Has Become the Far Left Coast
summary: Bullet trains and single payer don't work, but Golden State Democrats demand them anyway.. California's descent into a one-party state accelerated in 2018. Golden State Democrats picked up seven seats in the House. They now control almost 87% of the state's congressional delegation-46 of the 53 representatives. Orange County, one of the original strongholds of the conservative movement, is now a liberal bastion. Democrats hold both U.S. Senate seats and all eight elected statewide offices.

title: We're Overmedicating Our Children
summary: The use of drugs as a quick fix doesn't help kids become resilient to stress or emotionally mature.. A couple came to my psychotherapy office because their 8-year-old son was having trouble at school. He couldn't sit still or focus on class work, and sometimes he'd act disruptively to get attention. The school had labeled the boy as having attention deficit and hyperactivity disorder and urged the parents to see a psychiatrist-who immediately prescribed a stimulant.

title: Story of the Year
summary: You have to be obtuse to stare at this jobs record and pretend it isn't happening.. The great political challenge of our time is sorting out what matters from what's just chatter. The din of distracting statistical noise is overwhelming. A Democratic governor named Inslee announces he's going to run for the U.S. presidency on one issue-climate change. Days later, the real president delivers a speech of immeasurable length to a conference of conservatives about pretty much everything rattling around in his head. The new week dawns with a Democratic House committee chairman named Nadler demanding that 81 of the president's "associates" provide him with a document dump.

title: The Democratic Primary From Hell
summary: New rules, endless candidates and a front-loaded schedule. Pass the popcorn.. With the addition of Washington Gov. Jay Inslee and former Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper, 14 Democrats are now running for president.

title: Trump Has Been Bad for Farmers
summary: Bankruptcies are way up, in part because of his immigration and trade policies.. The Trump administration has been bad for American farmers. In 2018 farm incomes declined $9.1 billion and total farm debt rose to $410 billion, the highest in nearly 40 years. Bankruptcies are more frequent than during the Great Recession, and they are up 59% in the region that includes my home state of Colorado, compared with 2008. Low commodity prices, persistent drought and labor shortages have pushed many farmers to the edge.

title: 'The Third Pillar' Review: Why Washington Is the Problem
summary: National politics has become hogtied by culture wars. A high priest of economics has a modest proposal: Strengthen local communities.. Recently 35% of Americans told Gallup pollsters that they trust the Federal government's handling of domestic problems, while 72% said they trust their local government. Given this mismatch in public confidence, should Washington do less and local governments do more?
